intro: Cheilanthes albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin hawksbeard, is a species of fern found in arid and rocky habitats. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rock surfaces, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are often pale green with a distinctive white margin, which helps reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. This fern is well adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
